name: ACLU
headline: Defender of rights and liberties
description:
The ACLU is our nation's guardian of liberty, working daily in courts, legislatures and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties that the Constitution and laws of the United States guarantee everyone in this country. The ACLU is a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that has grown from a roomful of civil liberties activists in 1920 to an organization of more than 500,000 members and supporters today. We handle nearly 6,000 court cases annually from our offices in almost every state.

The ACLU is supported by annual dues and contributions from its members, plus grants from private foundations and individuals. We do not receive any government funding. 

We protect:
Your First Amendment rights - freedom of speech, association and assembly; freedom of the press, and freedom of religion. 
Your right to equal protection under the law - protection against unlawful discrimination. 
Your right to due process - fair treatment by the government whenever the loss of your liberty or property is at stake. 
Your right to privacy - freedom from unwarranted government intrusion into your personal and private affairs. 
The ACLU also works to extend rights to segments of our population that have traditionally been denied their rights, including people of color; women; lesbians, gay men, bisexuals and transgender people; prisoners; and people with disabilities.

##  Defend the rights of all people nationwide 
With immigrant rights, trans justice, reproductive freedom, and more at risk, we’re in courts and communities across the country to protect everyone’s rights — and we need you with us. 
[ Donate Now ](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/action.aclu.org/give/now?ms_aff=NAT&initms_aff=NAT&ms=web_hero_redesign_hp&initms=web_hero_redesign_hp&ms_chan=web&initms_chan=web>)

![A person holding up a sign reading "A World Without Trans People Has Never Existed And Never Will" at a demonstration.](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2025/02/sex-descrimination-full-bleed-1000x500.jpg)
### Trump Promoting Sex Discrimination, Explained
[Trump Promoting Sex Discrimination, Explained](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/news/lgbtq-rights/trumps-executive-orders-promoting-sex-discrimination-explained>)
Trump’s sex discrimination mandate threatens to deny freedom to transgender people across the country. 
Learn More

Take our quiz to see how much you know about the history of birthright citizenship and the legality of Trump’s order. 
Test Your Knowledge

### States Will be The Frontlines of Our Freedom 
[States Will be The Frontlines of Our Freedom ](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/firewall-for-freedom-states-must-safeguard-our-rights>)
We’re urging states to ensure that individuals’ rights and freedoms aren’t stripped away by federal force.
Read More
![A collage of images pertaining to the United States and Donald Trump.](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/11/TRUMP_CTA_Immigration_1160x650_Hero-1000x500.jpg)
### Protect Birthright Citizenship 
[Protect Birthright Citizenship ](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/action.aclu.org/send-message/protect-birthright-citizenship>)
Trump’s attack on birthright citizenship is unconstitutional and attacks a core American value. Tell Congress to fight back. 
Use Your Voice
The ACLU dares to create a more perfect union — beyond one person, party, or side. Our mission is to realize this promise of the United States Constitution for all and expand the reach of its guarantees.

## Systemic Equality
![A graphic of a child standing on a parent's shoulders.](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2023/12/systemic-equality-banner-optim.jpg)
Systemic Equality 
Since our nation’s founding, discriminatory policies and laws have created an unequal system in which Black communities have had their civil rights and liberties denied and have been systemically locked out of opportunities in education, housing, employment, and more.
Through our Systemic Equality agenda, we will use nationwide litigation, advocacy, and public education to advance laws and policies rooted in racial equity and end discriminatory policies, laws, and practices that have an outsized impact on Black communities.
Help us in our fight to ensure all people have equal access to housing, voting rights, education, and more by [learning more](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/news/topic/systemic-equality-addressing-americas-legacy-of-racism-and-systemic-discrimination>), pledging your support, or [donating](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/action.aclu.org/give/now>). When we have full and equal access to education, jobs, housing, voting rights and more, better futures are possible.

Donald Trump has positioned his administration to launch one of the most abusive and aggressive assaults on human rights in U.S. presidential history.

[Trump's Efforts to Dismantle AI Protections, Explained](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/news/privacy-technology/trumps-efforts-to-dismantle-ai-protections-explained>)
President Donald Trump has swiftly removed Artificial Intelligence protections, exposing people to real-world harms.
![Abstract virtual artificial Intelligence interface with human head hologram on USA flag and sunset sky background.](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2025/02/american-flag-ai-b-400x400.jpg)

Civil Liberties 
### Trump's Attempt to Unilaterally Control State and Local Funding is Dangerous, Dumb, and Undemocratic
[Trump's Attempt to Unilaterally Control State and Local Funding is Dangerous, Dumb, and Undemocratic](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/news/civil-liberties/trumps-attempt-to-unilaterally-control-state-and-local-funding-is-dangerous-dumb-and-undemocratic>)
Donald Trump's attempts to withhold vital funding to bully and coerce states into compliance is plainly unconstitutional.
![A demonstrator holds a sign that reads "Chicago Stands With Immigrant Families".](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2025/02/chicago-stands-with-immigrant-families-f-400x400.jpg)
## In the Courts
For more than one hundred years, ACLU lawyers have been at the center of one history-making court case after another, participating in more Supreme Court cases than any other private organization. With attorneys nationwide, we handle thousands of cases each year on behalf of clients whose rights have been violated. 
### Fighting For Reproductive Freedom
People deserve the freedom to make their own medical decisions — but extreme politicians want to take that power away and deny people essential healthcare like abortion and birth control. The ACLU will never stop fighting to ensure that every person can maker their own decisions around pregnancy. 
[Fighting For Reproductive Freedom](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/cases/brandt-et-al-v-rutledge-et-al>)
![A graphic that depicts individuals demonstrating for reproductive freedom.](https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/07/0502_InTheCourts_V3.jpg)
[ all court cases ](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/defending-our-rights/court-battles>)
### Fighting Trump
![Image of Supreme Court](https://www.aclu.org/wp-content/themes/aclu-wp/img/court.jpg)
During the first Trump administration, we took over **430 legal actions**. 
**[Fighting Back Against Voter Suppression in Georgia](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/cases/sixth-district-african-methodist-episcopal-church-v-kemp>)** Following record turnout in recent elections, Georgia legislators passed a voter suppression law designed to make it harder for voters, especially voters of color, to cast a ballot. We’re suing.
**[Defending Student Free Speech](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/cases/mahanoy-area-school-district-v-bl>)** Brandi Levy was just blowing off steam off campus when she posted an expletive message on Snapchat critical of her school and cheer team. She was suspended from her cheer team, but alongside the ACLU she sued to defend student free speech. We took the case all the way to the Supreme Court – and won.
[**Protecting Abortion Access in Florida**](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/cases/planned-parenthood-southwest-and-central-florida-et-al-v-state-florida-et-al>) On behalf of several abortion providers, we are fighting against Florida's senseless and harmful law that bans abortion after 15 weeks of pregnancy and threatens to imprison doctors who provide care beyond that point.
### [our history ](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/www.aclu.org/about-aclu>)
#### 1920
In its first year, the ACLU challenged the Palmer Raids, protecting immigrants and trade union members.
#### 1942
The ACLU stood almost alone in denouncing the federal government’s internment of more than 110,000 Japanese Americans in concentration camps.
#### 1967
The ACLU represented an interracial couple in the landmark Supreme Court case, Loving v. Virginia. The court ruled that state bans on interracial marriage were unconstitutional.
#### 1978
The ACLU took a controversial stand for free speech by defending a Nazi group that wanted to march through the Chicago suburb of Skokie—where many Holocaust survivors lived.
#### 2015
The ACLU won a landmark Supreme Court ruling in Obergefell v. Hodges, affirming the constitutional right of same-sex couples to marry.
#### 2018
In a victory for privacy, the Supreme Court ruled in an ACLU case, Carpenter v. United States, that people’s sensitive cell phone location data is protected by the Fourth Amendment, requiring the government get a warrant to access it.
#### today
We have over 1,700 staffers in every state, Washington, D.C., and Puerto Rico fighting for people's constitutional rights.

###  Get Involved 
People Power is the ACLU's platform for grassroots action. We work with volunteers and supporters in every corner of the country to defend civil liberties and civil rights. Join us. 
[Make calls](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/go.peoplepower.org/signup/join-our-people-power-volunteer-teams/?type=call>)
[Join a volunteer team](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/go.peoplepower.org/signup/join-our-people-power-volunteer-teams/?type=text>)
[Host an event](https://www.aclu.org/<https:/go.peoplepower.org/signup/host_new/>)
Tips from our Volunteers 
  * “Pick one issue that affects you directly and one that doesn’t, and work on them. You’ll burn out if you think you have to fix everything.”
  * “Activism is not a competition, says Lily Levin. If you can only do an hour of activism a week, that’s OK. Do something concrete at every meeting, like call your reps or send postcards.”
  * “And to paraphrase MLK Jr., be prepared for infinite disappointments, but carry infinite hope that we can change everything eventually.”


“Pick one issue that affects you directly and one that doesn’t, and work on them. You’ll burn out if you think you have to fix everything.”

## Donate to the ACLU
The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for more than 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.
**We need you with us to keep fighting — donate today.**

##  Defend the rights of all people nationwide 
With immigrant rights, trans justice, reproductive freedom, and more at risk, we’re in courts and communities across the country to protect everyone’s rights — and we need you with us. 
 Donate Now ⟨47⟩
## Spotlight 
![A person holding up a sign reading "A World Without Trans People Has Never Existed And Never Will" at a demonstration.⟨48⟩]
### Trump Promoting Sex Discrimination, Explained
Trump Promoting Sex Discrimination, Explained⟨49⟩
Trump’s sex discrimination mandate threatens to deny freedom to transgender people across the country. 
Learn More
![A collage of images pertaining to birthright citizenship.⟨50⟩]
### How Much Do You Know About Birthright Citizenship?
How Much Do You Know About Birthright Citizenship?⟨51⟩
Take our quiz to see how much you know about the history of birthright citizenship and the legality of Trump’s order. 
Test Your Knowledge
![A collage containing images of civil liberties of the United States⟨52⟩]
### States Will be The Frontlines of Our Freedom 
States Will be The Frontlines of Our Freedom ⟨53⟩
We’re urging states to ensure that individuals’ rights and freedoms aren’t stripped away by federal force.
Read More
![A collage of images pertaining to the United States and Donald Trump.⟨54⟩]
### Protect Birthright Citizenship 
Protect Birthright Citizenship ⟨55⟩
Trump’s attack on birthright citizenship is unconstitutional and attacks a core American value. Tell Congress to fight back. 
Use Your Voice
The ACLU dares to create a more perfect union — beyond one person, party, or side. Our mission is to realize this promise of the United States Constitution for all and expand the reach of its guarantees. 
## Issues
Learn about what's happening across **the most pressing civil liberties issues** of our time, and what you can do.

## Systemic Equality
![A graphic of a child standing on a parent's shoulders.⟨60⟩]
Systemic Equality 
Since our nation’s founding, discriminatory policies and laws have created an unequal system in which Black communities have had their civil rights and liberties denied and have been systemically locked out of opportunities in education, housing, employment, and more.
Through our Systemic Equality agenda, we will use nationwide litigation, advocacy, and public education to advance laws and policies rooted in racial equity and end discriminatory policies, laws, and practices that have an outsized impact on Black communities.
Help us in our fight to ensure all people have equal access to housing, voting rights, education, and more by learning more⟨61⟩, pledging your support, or donating⟨62⟩. When we have full and equal access to education, jobs, housing, voting rights and more, better futures are possible.
## News and Commentary⟨63⟩
News & Commentary ⟨63⟩
![A photo of the UN flag.⟨64⟩]
Human Rights 
### The Targeted Chaos of Trump’s Attacks Against International Human Rights Law and Justice
The Targeted Chaos of Trump’s Attacks Against International Human Rights Law and Justice⟨65⟩
Donald Trump has positioned his administration to launch one of the most abusive and aggressive assaults on human rights in U.S. presidential history. 
![A photo of the UN flag.⟨66⟩]
![Abstract virtual artificial Intelligence interface with human head hologram on USA flag and sunset sky background.⟨67⟩]
Privacy & Technology 
### Trump's Efforts to Dismantle AI Protections, Explained
Trump's Efforts to Dismantle AI Protections, Explained⟨68⟩
President Donald Trump has swiftly removed Artificial Intelligence protections, exposing people to real-world harms.
![Abstract virtual artificial Intelligence interface with human head hologram on USA flag and sunset sky background.⟨69⟩]
![A demonstrator holds a sign that reads "Chicago Stands With Immigrant Families".⟨70⟩]
Civil Liberties 
### Trump's Attempt to Unilaterally Control State and Local Funding is Dangerous, Dumb, and Undemocratic
Trump's Attempt to Unilaterally Control State and Local Funding is Dangerous, Dumb, and Undemocratic⟨71⟩
Donald Trump's attempts to withhold vital funding to bully and coerce states into compliance is plainly unconstitutional.
![A demonstrator holds a sign that reads "Chicago Stands With Immigrant Families".⟨72⟩]
## In the Courts
For more than one hundred years, ACLU lawyers have been at the center of one history-making court case after another, participating in more Supreme Court cases than any other private organization. With attorneys nationwide, we handle thousands of cases each year on behalf of clients whose rights have been violated. 
### Fighting For Reproductive Freedom
People deserve the freedom to make their own medical decisions — but extreme politicians want to take that power away and deny people essential healthcare like abortion and birth control. The ACLU will never stop fighting to ensure that every person can maker their own decisions around pregnancy. 
Fighting For Reproductive Freedom⟨73⟩
![A graphic that depicts individuals demonstrating for reproductive freedom.⟨74⟩]
 all court cases ⟨75⟩
### Fighting Trump
![Image of Supreme Court⟨76⟩]
During the first Trump administration, we took over **430 legal actions**. 
**Fighting Back Against Voter Suppression in Georgia⟨77⟩** Following record turnout in recent elections, Georgia legislators passed a voter suppression law designed to make it harder for voters, especially voters of color, to cast a ballot. We’re suing.
**Defending Student Free Speech⟨78⟩** Brandi Levy was just blowing off steam off campus when she posted an expletive message on Snapchat critical of her school and cheer team. She was suspended from her cheer team, but alongside the ACLU she sued to defend student free speech. We took the case all the way to the Supreme Court – and won.
**Protecting Abortion Access in Florida**⟨79⟩ On behalf of several abortion providers, we are fighting against Florida's senseless and harmful law that bans abortion after 15 weeks of pregnancy and threatens to imprison doctors who provide care beyond that point.
### our history ⟨80⟩
#### 1920
In its first year, the ACLU challenged the Palmer Raids, protecting immigrants and trade union members.
#### 1942
The ACLU stood almost alone in denouncing the federal government’s internment of more than 110,000 Japanese Americans in concentration camps.
#### 1967
The ACLU represented an interracial couple in the landmark Supreme Court case, Loving v. Virginia. The court ruled that state bans on interracial marriage were unconstitutional.
#### 1978
The ACLU took a controversial stand for free speech by defending a Nazi group that wanted to march through the Chicago suburb of Skokie—where many Holocaust survivors lived.
#### 2015
The ACLU won a landmark Supreme Court ruling in Obergefell v. Hodges, affirming the constitutional right of same-sex couples to marry.
#### 2018
In a victory for privacy, the Supreme Court ruled in an ACLU case, Carpenter v. United States, that people’s sensitive cell phone location data is protected by the Fourth Amendment, requiring the government get a warrant to access it.
#### today
We have over 1,700 staffers in every state, Washington, D.C., and Puerto Rico fighting for people's constitutional rights.

###  Get Involved 
People Power is the ACLU's platform for grassroots action. We work with volunteers and supporters in every corner of the country to defend civil liberties and civil rights. Join us. 
Make calls⟨89⟩
Join a volunteer team⟨90⟩
Host an event⟨91⟩
Tips from our Volunteers 
  * “Pick one issue that affects you directly and one that doesn’t, and work on them. You’ll burn out if you think you have to fix everything.”
  * “Activism is not a competition, says Lily Levin. If you can only do an hour of activism a week, that’s OK. Do something concrete at every meeting, like call your reps or send postcards.”
  * “And to paraphrase MLK Jr., be prepared for infinite disappointments, but carry infinite hope that we can change everything eventually.”


“Pick one issue that affects you directly and one that doesn’t, and work on them. You’ll burn out if you think you have to fix everything.”

## Donate to the ACLU
The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for more than 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.
**We need you with us to keep fighting — donate today.**
 Donate ⟨92⟩

generated_description:
## ACLU: A Snapshot

The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a stalwart defender of rights and liberties in the United States. Founded in 1920, it began as a small group of civil liberties activists and has grown into a powerhouse, boasting over 500,000 members and supporters nationwide. With a dedicated team of about 1,700 employees, the ACLU operates from almost every state, tackling approximately 6,000 court cases annually.

### Mission and Purpose

The ACLU’s mission is straightforward yet profound: to preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed to all people by the U.S. Constitution and laws. This nonprofit, nonpartisan organization strives to protect a broad array of rights, including:

- **First Amendment Rights:** Protecting freedoms related to speech, assembly, press, and religion.
- **Equal Protection:** Fighting against unlawful discrimination.
- **Due Process:** Ensuring fair treatment in legal proceedings.
- **Privacy Rights:** Defending individuals from unwarranted government intrusions.

Moreover, the ACLU is dedicated to fighting for marginalized groups who have historically faced rights denials, including people of color, women, and LGBTQ+ individuals.

### Funding and Affiliation

Uniquely positioned among organizations of its ilk, the ACLU does not accept government funding. It relies entirely on membership dues, private contributions, and grants from foundations and individuals, which empowers it to advocate independently and vigorously.

### Notable Issues and Initiatives

The ACLU actively engages in various social justice issues such as:

- **Reproductive Freedom:** Advocating for the right to make personal health decisions.
- **Racial Justice:** Addressing systemic inequalities and discriminatory practices.
- **Voting Rights:** Protecting access to the ballot box for all citizens.
- **Transgender Rights:** Championing the rights and dignity of transgender individuals.

In the face of ongoing threats to civil liberties, the ACLU's action is more critical than ever. They engage with communities, lobby for legislative changes, and fight in court whenever rights are violated.

### Historical Impact

The ACLU has a storied history as a pioneer in civil rights advocacy. Over the decades, its legal battles have significantly influenced American law and society. Key milestones include:

- **Defending Japanese Americans** during their internment in WWII.
- Winning the landmark **Loving v. Virginia** case which overturned bans on interracial marriage.
- Advocating for **same-sex marriage rights** in the landmark case of Obergefell v. Hodges.

### Get Involved

Anyone looking to support civil liberties can join the ACLU through donations or volunteer opportunities. They encourage grassroots activism through their People Power platform, allowing individuals to partake in various advocacy efforts.

For more detailed information about their ongoing work and campaigns, you can visit the ACLU’s website at [aclu.org](https://www.aclu.org/).

In essence, the ACLU embodies a commitment to uphold and extend the liberties and rights that are foundational to American democracy—an endeavor as vital today as it was over a century ago.
